boofcv.alg.feature.detect.quadblob
Class FindQuadCorners

java.lang.Object
  boofcv.alg.feature.detect.quadblob.FindQuadCorners

public class FindQuadCorners
extends java.lang.Object

Find a list of corner pixels in a blob using its contour. Four corners are assumed. A list of candidate corners is done looking for local minimums in acute angle across the contour. From these candidates the candidate with the smallest acute angle is selected and used as the initial seed. Next the candidate which is the farthest distance is selected. This process is repeated two more times, each time maximizing the distance to all the previously selected corners.

Author:
Peter Abeles

Method Detail

process

public java.util.List<Point2D_I32> process(java.util.List<Point2D_I32> contour)
Finds corners from list of contour points and orders contour points into clockwise order.

Parameters:
contour - An unordered list of contour points. Is modified to be on clockwise order.
Returns:
List of 4 best corner points in clockwise order.

protected static void sortByAngleCCW(Point2D_I32 center,
                                     java.util.List<Point2D_I32> contour)
Sorts the points in counter clockwise direction around the provided point

Parameters:
center - Point that the angle is computed relative to
contour - List of all the points which are to be sorted by angle

computeResponse

protected void computeResponse(java.util.List<Point2D_I32> contour,
                               int radius,
                               double[] response)
Computes the acute angle for each pixel in the contour. The acute angle is computed by selecting two points which are 'radius' indexes away and finding the relative angle between those two vectors.
